matlab
Class MatlabProxyController

java.lang.Object
  matlab.MatlabProxyController

public class MatlabProxyController
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class that allows for controlling a single session of MATLAB without having to create a MatlabProxyFactory and then create a MatlabProxy.

Author:
Joshua Kaplan
See Also:
MatlabProxyFactory, MatlabProxy

Method Detail

createConnection

public static void createConnection()
                             throws MatlabConnectionException
Create a connection to MATLAB. If a connection already exists this method will not do anything. This must be called before any methods that control MATLAB are called, or those methods will throw runtime exceptions.

Throws:
MatlabConnectionException

setMatlabLocation

public static void setMatlabLocation(java.lang.String matlabLocation)
Set the location of the MATLAB program. If this property is not set an appropriate default for your operating system will be used. If that fails, then use this method to give the correct location.

Parameters:
matlabLocation -

setTimeout

public static void setTimeout(int ms)
Sets the maximum amount of time to wait in attempting to setup a connection to MATLAB in milliseconds. The default value is 60 seconds.

Parameters:
ms -

isConnected

public static boolean isConnected()
Returns whether or not this controller is connected to MATLAB.

Returns:
if connected to MATLAB

eval

public static void eval(java.lang.String command)
Evaluate a string, MATLAB script, or MATLAB function

Parameters:
command -

feval

public static void feval(java.lang.String command,
                         java.lang.Object[] args)
Evaluate a MATLAB function that requires arguments. Each element of the "args" array is an argument to the function "command"

Parameters:
command -
args -

blockingFeval

public static java.lang.Object blockingFeval(java.lang.String command,
                                             java.lang.Object[] args)
Evaluate a MATLAB function that requires arguments and provide return arg. Each element of the "args" array is an argument to the function "command"

Parameters:
command -
args -
Returns:
result of function, may be null

setEchoEval

public static void setEchoEval(boolean echo)
Echoing the eval statement is useful if you want to see in MATLAB each time that a java function tries to execute a MATLAB command.

Parameters:
echo -
